docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 2 -- Ignoring a request by the Israeli Government for an urgent decision, the Security Council today referred Israeli's application for membership in the United Nations to its membership committee for study.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 2 -- Ignoring a request by the Israeli Government for an urgent decision, the Security Council today referred Israeli's application for membership in the United Nations to its membership committee for study.

headline.main: U.N. Council Delays Action On Israel's Membership Bid; Body Refers the Application to Committee -- U.S. Urged Quick Acceptance, Britain Postponement -- Turmoil in Assembly U.N. BODY DELAYS ON ISRAELI MOVE

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 2 -- Apparently unanimous agreement has been reached in the General Assembly of the United Nations that the United Nations Appeal for Children shall be continued. The only question now is whether it is to be maintained as an independent...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 2 -- Apparently unanimous agreement has been reached in the General Assembly of the United Nations that the United Nations Appeal for Children shall be continued. The only question now is whether it is to be maintained as an independent non-governmental organization or be made an adjunct of the International Children's Emergency Fund, which is an intergovernmental body.
docs.abstract: UN Assembly Soc Com reprs urge continuation of Appeal for Children; Mrs F D Roosevelt urges Appeal merger with Fund

headline.main: U.N. WILL CONTINUE CHILDREN'S APPEAL; Mrs. Roosevelt Leads in Move for Its Fusion With Fund -- 14 Nations for Separation

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 3 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly virtually completed action tonight on the resolution that would give to the proposed conciliation commission a virtually free hand in its efforts to work out...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 3 -- The Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly virtually completed action tonight on the resolution that would give to the proposed conciliation commission a virtually free hand in its efforts to work out a permanent settlement in Palestine.

headline.main: CONCILIATION PLAN FOR PALESTINE RIFT PREPARED BY U.N.; Action on Resolution to Give Free Hand to Commission Is Virtually Completed

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 -- The Treaty of Rio de Janeiro, binding nations of the Western Hemisphere to mutual defense against any and all aggression, became operative at 12:27 P.M. today.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 3 -- The Treaty of Rio de Janeiro, binding nations of the Western Hemisphere to mutual defense against any and all aggression, became operative at 12:27 P.M. today.
docs.abstract: Rio de Janeiro Treaty goes into effect as Costa Rica ratifies; Sec Gen Lleras Camargo signs for Organization of Amer States; illus; Sec Marshall message notes UN links; Sens Vandenberg and Connally stress security aims

headline.main: RIO DEFENSE PACT, AMERICAS' ALLIANCE, BECOMES EFFECTIVE; Ceremony Marks Ratifications of Treaty, Now Pattern for Atlantic Security

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES -- Whenever the political atmosphere in Europe gets stormy, norte-americanos with travel dollars to spend look south; and, accordingly, ten South American republics are looking hopefully to their shares of a banner tourist season....
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES -- Whenever the political atmosphere in Europe gets stormy, norte-americanos with travel dollars to spend look south; and, accordingly, ten South American republics are looking hopefully to their shares of a banner tourist season. Remember, winter is summer below the Equator.

headline.main: TO LANDS WHERE IT'S SUMMER; South American Tourist Is Advised to Watch Out For Political Action

docs.snippet: Steps aimed at further extension of the reciprocal trade agreements program of the United States will begin on Tuesday in Washington when concurrent hearings will be held by the United States Tariff Commission and the revamped interdepartmental...
docs.lead_paragraph: Steps aimed at further extension of the reciprocal trade agreements program of the United States will begin on Tuesday in Washington when concurrent hearings will be held by the United States Tariff Commission and the revamped interdepartmental Committee for Reciprocity Information.
docs.abstract: US Tariff Comm and Reciprocity Information Com (CRI) set concurrent hearings on extending reciprocal agreements and new tariff concessions under Geneva Tarin Agreements

headline.main: GENEVA PROPOSALS ON TARIFF READIED; Two Hearings Begin Tuesday Concurrently in Washington on Reciprocal Agreements

docs.snippet: PARIS, Dec. 4 -- A resolution providing for establishment of a Palestine conciliation commission was approved today by the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Dec. 4 -- A resolution providing for establishment of a Palestine conciliation commission was approved today by the Political and Security Committee of the United Nations General Assembly.
docs.abstract: pol com approves motion to form conciliation comm, 26-21; Canadian amendment orders comm selection by Big 5 without veto; Assembly approval without major changes doubted

headline.main: Palestine Conciliation Body Is Voted by U.N. Committee; But Close Margin Indicates That Revisions In Resolution Will Be Necessary for Its Approval by the General Assembly
